meanings.definition: To break off or sever ties with an organization or group.
meanings.sent1: She disaffiliated from the club after a disagreement.
meanings.sent2: The company disaffiliated from its previous partners.
meanings.sent3: The cat disaffiliated from the other animals in the house by hiding in a box.
meanings.sent4: The river disaffiliated from its usual path during the flood.
meanings.sent5: The student disaffiliated from the study group to focus on individual work.

meanings.definition: Not officially connected or associated with a particular organization or group.
meanings.sent1: He felt disaffiliated from the team after being left out of the project.
meanings.sent2: The disaffiliated members formed their own independent group.
meanings.sent3: The disaffiliated phone company had unique services that set it apart.
meanings.sent4: The disaffiliated island had its own distinct culture.
meanings.sent5: The disaffiliated artist found success by following their own path.
